intro: Amphithalea ornata, commonly known as the golden star, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical and subtropical species. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a star-like appearance. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture. Amphithalea ornata typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
